question: A 55-year-old female presents with profuse aching pain in both knees and limitation of movements. Her joint examination reveals Heberden nodes in distal interphalangeal joints of both hands. Which of the following conditions is associated with Heberden nodes?

A 6-year-old boy came to the outpatient department (OPD) with a complaint of short stature. On examination, his height is 92 cm and the X-ray shows bullet-like carpal bones. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 60-year-old female with severe pain in the lumbar region has been diagnosed with osteoarthritis by her rheumatologist. What is the main pathophysiology of osteoarthritis?

answers.option: Degeneration of articular cartilage and its disordered repair
Autoimmune inflammatory disorder of the joints
Non suppurative proliferative and inflammatory synovitis

question: A 21-year-old male is recently diagnosed with osteoblastoma. Which of the following is the most common site of occurrence of osteoblastoma?
A 21-year-old man with signs of urethritis, conjunctivitis, and arthritis has been diagnosed as having a sexually transmitted infection (STI). What is the most likely cause of his disease?

A 30-years-old male presented with a history of sudden onset acute pain in his big toe. He woke up in the morning with fever and malaise but was perfectly alright the day before. He denies any comorbid state nor is using any medication currently. On examination, his foot reveals an inflamed big toe with marked tenderness. What is the most likely diagnosis on clinical grounds?
A 33-year-old female with rheumatoid arthritis is currently on methotrexate and came to you for opinion regarding conception. What would be the best advice to give to her?

answers.option: Stop methotrexate at least 3 months before conception
Stop methotrexate one month before conception
Stop methotrexate one year before conception
Continue the drug but add on folic acid

question: A 55-year-old male presented to the clinic with the complaint of fever, weight loss, and back pain. On physical examination, extreme tenderness was noticed at the lumbar vertebrae. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the lumbar spine showed evidence of Pott’s disease. Which of the following organisms is most commonly involved in this disease process?

A 58-year-old woman discussed osteoporosis with her physician. She was worried that for a couple of years, after menopause, she was at an increased risk for osteoporosis. Which of the following is prescribed initially to prevent the risk of future problems?

answers.option: Infusion of potent bisphosphonates at large intervals
Maintaining adequate calcium and vitamin D through diet modification and/or supplementation

question: A 45-year-old lady presented with sudden-onset of difficulty in micturition, and significant bilateral lower limb weakness. Examination reveals the power of 1/5 in both lower limbs, with saddle anesthesia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Aspirin generally should be avoided as an anti-inflammatory drug in gout because it counteracts the effect of which of the following drugs that is used in a hyperuricemic patient?
What is the best imaging modality for assessment of bone mineral density?
Cupping, splaying, and fraying of the lower end of the radius are seen in which of the following conditions?
How can doping be defined as?

answers.option: Stimulant given to an athlete to affect performance
Creation of stimuli by an exercise program to produce high level of function
Intake of excess carbohydrates to increase glycogen store
Intake of excessive fat to have more stamina

question: External fixation is the best method of fixation for which of the following?
Which of the following cells are responsible to regulate bone matrix formation and bone mineralization?
What is the phenomenon of friction with opposing degenerated articular surfaces producing smooth bone and burnishing the exposed bones called?

Which of the following can be caused by inhalation of coal dust?
Which of the following diseases is caused by ionizing radiation, X-rays, and radioactive isotopes?
Which of the following is a reliable and the most common method used for disinfection of water?
A young male presents with migratory joint pain for the last 1 week. In addition, he has had diarrhea for a week. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a causative factor for the development of congenital limb anomalies?

answers.option: Combination of genetic and environmental factors

question: What will be the primary cause of death from massive acetaminophen overdose?
Uric acid is the metabolic end product of which of the following compounds?
A 2-year-old child is suspected with rickets, what important X-ray would you advice for this child?
"Soap bubble" appearance on radiography is typical of which bone tumor?
Sabre shin is a feature of congenital syphilis. Which part of the tibia is typically affected?
Which of the following is the best first step of management for osteoarthritis?
Which of the following is a complication of humeral shaft fracture?
Which of the following is a complication of crush syndrome?
What is the most common cause of primary osteoarthritis?
Which bursa is most likely to get inflammed in house cleaning women?
Which of the following is the most common type of osteogenesis imperfecta?
Which of the following is not a growing end of the bone?
Which of the following is the end-product of purine metabolism?
Which of the following features differentiates polymyositis from dermatomyositis?

answers.option: Myalgia is seen in only one of them
One of them is an immunological disease
Cutaneous features are only seen in dermatomyositis
Muscle weakness is seen only in polymyositis

question: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the clinic with complaints of pain and swelling in his lower right leg. Past history is remarkable for compound open fracture of tibia and fibula of the same leg 1 year ago. The fracture was treated using an external fixator and the skin was sutured. The x-ray of the affected limb will most likely show which of the following findings?

A 20-year-old female presents with pain in the wrist and hand joints and a typical malar rash for the past 2 weeks. On investigation, urine is negative for proteins. Her past medical records show that she is a diagnosed patient with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). What treatment should be given to this patient?
Which of these factors is responsible for absorption of phosphorus from the intestine?
Which of the following is the most common carpal bone to be fractured?
How is a Colle's fracture managed?
Which of the following conditions is caused by breathing in iron dust?
According to the Salter-Harris classification, which fracture type leads to complete growth arrest?
A 40-year-old man works at a sandblasting factory. What is the name of the condition that he is likely to develop?
Which of the following NSAIDs can cause the most GI bleeding problems?
Calcitonin is secreted by which of the following endocrine glands?
An osteoarthritis patient was given non-pharmacological treatment which did not improve their condition. What is the next step in management?
What is the most common cause of osteomyelitis in neonates?
What is the most common cause of osteomyelitis in intravenous drug abusers?
Under which of the following systems do we classify open bone fractures?
During a 1000m race, a kid collapses during the final part of the race and is rushed to the hospital for treatment. What is the most probable cause of this kid's collapse?
An 8-year-old child presents to the outpatient clinic with a history of joint pain, swelling, rashes on the buttocks, and occasional abdominal pain. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 50-year-old presents to the physician because of a 4-month history of back pain. He notes that the pain is relieved by stooping forward. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 22-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with complaints of bone pain and a mass around the knee that is increasing in size very rapidly. The biopsy of the mass shows bone formation by tumor cells. Which of the following organs is most likely to be affected first?

A 70-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of pain in the left thigh. Histological evaluation reveals a mosaic pattern of lamellar bone. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the below enlisted is a characteristic finding on plain radiograph of a patient with osteoarthritis?

A 40-year-old man presents to the emergency department with a swollen, exquisitely painful big toe. The attending physician started intravenous fluids and indomethacin, making a provisional diagnosis of gout. However, he fails to improve. The patient is afebrile, and no other joint is involved. His mother arrives and gave a detailed history, that he had few episodes of bloody diarrhea a few weeks back for which they took treatment from a local doctor. Hearing this, the doctor immediately changed his differential. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 40-year-old lady taking methotrexate for rheumatoid arthritis complains of nausea and vomiting for the last 2 weeks. What should be the appropriate measure to reduce these side effects?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the use of methotrexate during pregnancy?

A 40-year-old woman presents to the clinic with shortness of breath, nausea, and difficulty walking upstairs. She has been taking medication for rheumatoid arthritis for the past 8 months. Which drug is most likely responsible for her complaints?

A 40-year-old female presents to the physician with complaints of abdominal discomfort and weakness. She has a history of rheumatoid arthritis, for which she takes methotrexate. Examination shows splenomegaly, conjunctival pallor, and skin hyperpigmentation. Laboratory tests show 700 neutrophils per microliter of blood. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following drugs is effective in managing acute gouty arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and also accelerates closure of patent ductus arteriosus in premature infants?
Which of the following drugs may precipitate an attack of acute gout?
Which of the following drugs is least likely to precipitate an attack of acute gout?
Which of the following are components of Reiter's syndrome?

A 28-year-old male presents to the clinic because of swollen, painful small joints in his right hand. On examination, there is a scaly rash on the extensor surfaces of the skin and scalp. Which of the following diagnosis is most consistent with this case?
Osteomyelitis is most commonly a bacterial infection that arises via hematogenous spread. Which of the following organisms is the most common cause of this disease?
Pannus formation is a feature of which of the below-enlisted hematological conditions?
Ewing's sarcoma is a primary malignant bone tumor, what cells does it arise from?
A 3-day old baby presents with club foot. What would be the ideal first-line management for him?

answers.option: No treatment- reassure parents that this will get better on its own

question: Which type of lower limb orthosis is typically prescribed in club foot?
Which of the following is the permissible E coli limit for safe drinking water?
Which of the following is a non-nitrogenous bisphosphonate?
What joint is most commonly involved in pseudogout?
Which antibody is associated with interstitial lung disease in patients with polymyositis and dermatomyositis?

A man with a history of a fall presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of pain in the lower back. On examination, the power in the lower limbs is 2/5 and the perianal sensation is intact. There is no urinary retention. What is the most probable diagnosis?
What is the origin of osteoblastic metastases to bone?
What will be the method of choice in managing a closed adult femoral shaft fracture?
What is the most common site of osteosarcoma?
What would vitamin D toxicity lead to?
Which of the following tumors arises from the diaphysis of bone?

A 57-year-old male, a known case of diabetes and hypertension, presents with a history of severe pain in his right big toe. On examination, his first metatarsophalangeal joint is markedly tender and shows signs of inflammation. What could be the most likely cause of his condition?

A 65-year-old male presents with a history of severe knee joint pain bilaterally. He describes that he has had this pain intermittently for the last 4 years. He has gotten multiple medical treatments, but the pain has been refractory to all of them. An x-ray of the knee joint shows signs of advanced osteoarthritis. What is the best treatment opinion for him?
A force within normal limits is exerted repeatedly leading to a fracture. What is this type of fracture called?

A young female presents to the clinic with a history of pain in the small joints of her hands and tightening of her skin for 3 months. She is also having difficulty swallowing and has oral ulcers. On examination, her blood pressure is 140/90 mmHg and she is noted to have a small mouth and epicanthal folds. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A young female presents to the clinic with acute lupus nephritis. Which of the following is the best treatment option for her?
Which of the following diseases is characterized by a progressive erosion of articular cartilage?
The earth's hydrosphere is around 1.386 billion cubic kilometers. What is the percentage of fresh water?
Gout is a metabolic disorder of which of the following?
The study of the relationship of workers with machines and the working environment best corresponds to which of the following?
Which of the following refers to the group of diseases resulting from the respirable fraction of different chemicals leading to irreversible fibrosis of the lung?
What is the objective of occupational health?

answers.option: Protecting the workers in their employment
The promotion and maintenance of highest degree of physical, mental, and social well-being of workers in all occupations
The promotion and maintenance of social well-being of workers
The promotion of physical well-being of workers
The maintenance of physical well-being of workers

question: Ozone gas is a major part of air pollution in cities. Which term best corresponds to ozone as a component of air pollution?
More than 90% of total body calcium is found in?
What is the triggering factor in osteitis deformans?
Which condition presents with the classic rash that takes the form of a heliotrope discoloration of the upper eyelids?
What is serum calcium affected by?
What is the correct statement regarding the general properties of disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (DMARDs)?

answers.option: They exert maximum direct anti-inflammatory or analgesic effects
Rheumatoid arthritis patients who have failed to respond one DMARD may not respond to the other
DMARDs retard the development of bone erosions or facilitate their healing
DMARDs are associated with minimal toxicity and therefore patient monitoring is not necessary
The beneficial effects of DMARD therapy usually appear after one week

question: Which of the following drugs specifically inhibits uric acid synthesis?

A 70-year-old obese male presents to the clinic with complaints of joint pain and morning stiffness that worsens with movement. On examination, there are bumps on his fingers. On radiological imaging, osteophytes and subchondral cysts are noted. The amount of cartilage in joints is reduced. Which of the following diseases is also associated with a reduced amount of cartilage in joints?
Which one of the following is a feature of osteoarthritis on an x-ray?
In purine degradation, what is inosine converted to?

How does probenecid cause acute gouty arthritis?
Which one of the following diseases is caused by exposure to ionizing radiations, x-rays, and radioactive isotopes?
Regarding the synthesis of vitamin D, which statement is correct?

answers.option: Calcitriol is the result of hydroacylation of cholecalciferol at two levels
Cholecalciferol is synthesized in the liver
No hydroxylation occurs in the liver or kidneys
Calcitriol binds with vitamin D binding proteins
